lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First and foremost, we have our first of two sponsors for tonight's episode, beginning with our friends at D&D Beyond.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All I know is that, first, you've got to get mad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want you to get up and grab your computer, enable voice detect, and I want you to yell, I want you to yell, "I'm mad! Mad!" I want you to yell, "I'm mad as hell "and I'm not going to take Sam anymore!" Mordenkainen is rolling in his grave! (prolonged beep)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What just happened? What did you cut to? What happened? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam and Liam, and thank you, well, D&D Beyond.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kids in 2019 love homages to films from the '70s.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Our fantastic second sponsor tonight, return sponsor, our friends at Idle Champions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They just apparently released a huge massive update focused on their year one champions, which includes a classic, Drizzt Do'Urden.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Check out the game at IdleChampions.com/CriticalRole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A couple other updates. First off, on Monday, July 29th, at 7PM Pacific here on the Twitch channel, we'll be airing our very own special Call of Cthulhu one-shot, run by our brilliant Taliesin Jaffe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think we've already announced, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, not everybody lived, but yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's so much creepier now that he doesn't have the clown wig on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We've already placed it on our YouTube channel, I believe, as it was on Talks this previous Tuesday, so if you missed it, it's available to watch now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you being salty to our audience?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also as a reminder, next week's episode of Critical Role will be on Friday instead of Thursday, as it will be our live show at Gen Con.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got our d20, our oversized d20, I may have had a hand in--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's sparkly. You can't really tell on the website.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god, it looks like Wonder Girl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got this-- oh, this bag o' dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then also, look at this cutie cutie chibi Jester pin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aww, look at that. Is that a donut behind her?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's yeah, for our comic book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where is that? Is that in our store?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's available in our US and our UK shop, right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This was our like sample one that came in, so it's like extra special.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can say yes now and then I might take it back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, right? I'm going to play with the oversized tonight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She'll play with every one that we make and sell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I still have an unhealthy amount of adrenaline.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, you are, you're like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Somewhere there's a parent who is realizing that he has to explain to their child what Network is, and that excites me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can feel hundreds of those conversations happening at once.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe that concludes our announcements, so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything you can tell us about this area before you leave?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not looking up, still drawing amongst the root.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I say, oh, sorry, no, go on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Otherwise, this would not have been "as tumultuous a journey."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it makes him more likable, to be honest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We will be in touch while we are here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me know, should you require anything."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just stalling for time a bit, if you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And with that," and he steps into the circle, and vanishes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you can do that, too. We're not stranded here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I haven't put us inside a wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've never been here before, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you seen it in your visions, though?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a little colder than I expected, but, (sighs) is there even the slightest sense of civilization anywhere? Are we just out in the middle of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where you stand right now, make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got to use that big dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true, you should've used this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you see is mountain, ridge, snow, tree, lava, and rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see no signs of civilization, you see no structures from this perspective, you're on the opposite side of this lake facing towards the mountain, Kravaraad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far are we from that lake? Can we see if it's frozen over?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, shit! Sorry, Deven, sorry, sorry, sorry, Deven.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This one was harder to get.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's got blood on it, too! Why do all our maps have blood on them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Emerald Gulch, so we're, what? Krakow? Where are we? What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a lake, yeah, not too far away from the Cindercrest Sanctum? Cindercrest? Cinderrest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think that's the one they said with the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we remember if that's the name?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's the gist of what you recall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to go meet elves and dwarves!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's right next door to where we're going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's as if destiny itself brought us here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great. You want me to spread this out?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Star Razor is the name of the sword?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which way do we go? Where do we enter?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Was anything passed down to you? You know, through spoken word from your family, or--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if there's like an entrance from the side or something that might be less deadly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The side door just seems very personal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sure we'll see as we head up, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is the lake frozen or liquid water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot see from this distance if the entire lake is not frozen or is frozen, but wherever the molten rock is hitting, there is steam rising.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That storm's on its way right now, right? It's definitely--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why don't we head towards the lake, see if we can find some warm water, and I don't know how far we're going to get before it gets impossible to move forward, but at least let's make our way there before we have to bed down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Follow and walk along the lake?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were at the beach yesterday.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got my big coat, and I put my hood up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel fine, but if anyone is cold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got some cold stuff that I bought.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm fine, I have my strength and physical prowess.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pull out the Rod of Hand Warming and I hand it over to Beau.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We never use the Rod of Smiles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can make people smile without it, so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Trees where we are or barren up to the mountainside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where you are, there are a few trees, not too closely clustered, and then the further down in the valley you go, the more it becomes a pinewood forest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we head towards it, and if anybody gets a feeling or sees anything along the way, just make yourself known.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to keep my eyes out for anything I get a feeling about.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll keep an eye on the treetops until we're out into a clearing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Could I have a marching order?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Caduceus is up front, and we have Fjord next to Caduceus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sipping on some booze to keep me warm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you were the one that was saying--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You said you were keeping an eye for anything strange.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it'll be the two of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, so you don't get help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I roll that one, too?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I think we both roll this one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, what if we both roll low on it? Oh good, ha ha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These large pieces of black volcanic rock.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd love to stop and look at one for a second, just to get a good, is it just volcanic rock, or is there any mineral deposits in it, if I give it a bit of a scrape and get into it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever this was, the entire mountain is not made of volcanic rock, but whatever this was, it was probably jettisoned out during some sort of an ancient explosion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, your hand begins to tingle, Caduceus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you had stayed the night in Nicodranas, and then journeyed back to Rosohna.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Traveling around what you had seen to be the southern side of it, you notice the mist start revealing shapes, and you think you see someone standing towards the edge of the lake as the treeline begins to thin, and you find yourself getting closer and closer to the edge of where this water begins.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caduceus, you don't think there's anybody like, bad over here, do you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I mean, depends on what you mean by bad, really, sometimes it's just people with a different agenda--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: People that will attack us, I mean, specifically.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I mean, that's not bad, just people, everybody attacks us, and yeah, probably, if history's any indication, we'll probably get attacked, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't we pretend like there might be people here who would attack us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, well in that case, I saw something in the mist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Over at the lake, right in front of us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's with figures in mist with us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I mean, it's a lovely day, why wouldn't you be out in it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This smoke isn't toxic, by the way, is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to lick the air.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It doesn't taste like burning or anything, it's just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, no, nothing odd, out of the ordinary, it is a cold moisture, it is just outside of the freezing point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take one of my extra sashes and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe leading with our fist is not necessarily, I'm not saying to take it off the table, but we're going to just try and come in for once and hope that perhaps we're being expected.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we like go out, like saying, "Oh hey, "Wildmother is the coolest," and stuff like that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wish you'd say that more often, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There was your family, the Clays, but there was also two others.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The priest of Dust was the one who started the kiln.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there some old word, some old name for it? Or is it just whatever word is being used for Dust these days?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know, the stories don't say if they were, they don't call them brothers, they don't say they were related, I couldn't tell you what they look like, or where they come from other than the fact three families all were at one point together, and obviously, friends and compatriots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just a big orgy of Clay and Dust and Stone!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The mist is getting to you a little quick here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know that there's a dozen names for the place I come from, and I've heard a couple different names for this place.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Any identifying features, or call and repeat that you guys might share?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would hope they would know the name Clay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are the most well-informed of us to this, so I think we all trust you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, it looks like it's standing on the banks, looking out across the lake.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't I go snoop around, just see what it is?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why don't we just call out to it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I almost did, I was just trying to be polite, because I know that makes everybody nervous when I do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, we haven't been super quiet walking up, and it looks like his back is to us, so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's just keep heading in that direction, and we won't try and be particularly sneaky about it, we'll just--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to try to be particularly sneaky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to dart off to the side, into the mist.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A low roll for a rogue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott darts off into the nearby forest, you guys continue heading towards the edge of the lake?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm actually going to see Nott do that and peel off and do the same.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You guys would let us know if there was anything ominous or suspicious coming up, right? I mean, you know, I feel like we're at that point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You figure the trees probably understood you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or it could be wind, I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter) A shimmer of arcane energy briefly apparates around the exterior of Caleb's body and then vanishes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The figure turns and looks towards you, the vacant dark eyes, the sockets where they should be, glancing in your direction, the hair seems to almost lift, and it vanishes into the mist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, she was bad, that's bad guy, that's bad guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to do a quick Detect Undead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But the music's still fine, we're okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm backing up away from the mist.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She disappeared into the lake, over the lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like her form just vanished into the mist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did she look at us scary, or did she just look at us vacantly?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I don't like it, I don't like it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why this campaign? Can't it just be some brutish ogre instead of scary shit that's going to make me wake up in the middle of the night?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope, it can only be that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just think about last night, everything will be fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For the next you know, few seconds, I get like a good six seconds of, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you focus, the exterior of your radius suddenly catches your attention to the right and left, and then pulls beyond your perspective range.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am full, we're going to...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want my real-- No, that'll do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around you, like the mist is thick here at the base of the valley, and looking just beyond where the water is, you see like shapes occasionally move, like a hand or a shoulder, and you glance off to the back, and Fjord, you follow Caduceus' eyes and glance over as you see another figure just looking at the edge of the mist and then steps backward and vanishes again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far are we from the water's edge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, you're about 50, 60 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're not in the mist yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the mist surrounds all of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh fuck, I thought we were like outside of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anybody feel like this mist is unnatural?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or perhaps the lake is part of the problem.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we need to get across this lake?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have to get across this lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can attempt to go across it or go around it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was hoping we were going to go around it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Our destination is on the other side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the other side of this lake.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can never be easy, can it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we could go in the lake and through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far across is the lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From one side to the other, I'd say

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Half a mile across the lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Half a mile across the lake to about a mile, somewhere in the neighborhood.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will cast Underwater Breathing on the entire group.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I still have an issue with this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's okay, we can just knock you out, it'll be all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean knock me out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're not going to do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It'll be like a day at the spa.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll just walk on the water.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My parents always said it's just best to sleep through these things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if the whole lake is filled with dead people?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if they grab us and we can't get out?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then you'll cast Turn Undead, it'll be okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right, I can do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, we're going to be okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, sometimes you can find water out in the wild that boils the flesh off of the bone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stop reading so many books, shit. Let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just put your finger in, Fjord!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is an icy, frozen surface.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool, glad I cast Underwater Breathing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we could cut a hole in the ice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll summon the falchion and just go shink and see if it even goes through or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and make a strength check for me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am keeping my eyes bloody peeled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it is your weapon, so I'd say you can use your charisma bonus in place of a strength check for this one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want me to help?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I cast Sacred Flame on the point he hit, just to try and melt it a bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try to shove the falchion down further and see if I can get through the ice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you're about to wedge it out and lift, Jester reaches over and puts her hands over yours, and roll a strength check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both just wiggle it back and forth a bit before eventually having to pull it free.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb sighs and then just points six feet away and starts doing concentrated Fire Bolts into one spot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yours does warm it a bit, but the fierceness of the arcane Fire Bolt continuously-- you're watching shards of ice go (small explosions) with each impact, and begin to melt away a bit, until-- it takes you about, I'd say two minutes or so to finally break through the ice to get to the water beneath it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we going to freeze to death down there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think most of us, maybe not you, maybe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to touch the water, how's it feel?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How far away are we from the point at which the lava hits the water?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So about a half a mile to a mile.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could also always just-- hmm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's all the dead people mist doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance around, you look over your shoulder, and right there next to your face, you see the gaunt skeletal visage of the eyeless woman, her stringy hair, like very Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking over your shoulder and then looks back into your face, and then vanishes in the mist.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're not fucking with us, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have goggles, can you see underwater if we put your head under and hold you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, why don't we put Beau's head under freezing water for a while?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was my idea, I can do it, I'll go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't-- yeah, just take a look, don't stay down there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll put my hands on the ice and stick my head under and see what I can see with my darkvision.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could do that, couldn't I?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll stick my-- I can-- oh yeah, go ahead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You poke your head down. It is murky water, and a lot of the light that would come in, while there is a storm above, is being refracted by the thick ice, so visibility is not great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While he's down there, globules into the water around his head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 30, 40 or so feet out, you can see some rocks and you can see a little bit of vegetation that lives beneath, but nothing beyond that catches your attention.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's not polluted, I didn't see any creatures swimming around, just seems to be a fresh water-- could I tell if it was fresh water?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seems like a fresh water lake.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was just thinking that in theory the kiln is in that mountain, which is in turn a crematory, which in turn means that the cremated remains of hundreds people might be rolling into this lake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I tighten my scarf around my face.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That also means that maybe inside the lake might be worse.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, they haven't messed with us yet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's just walk carefully with our eyes--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I think around it's still there, the mist's still there, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mist permeates the entirety of this basin and the base of this valley.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Normally I would say that we were less likely to get attacked from below if we don't walk across the lake, except the trouble with undead is that sometimes below is where they come from.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're walking around the outskirts of the lake.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would it add much to the time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say at a careful pace, that's another hour or so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we in danger of not making it by nightfall or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said a couple of hours when we arrive--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point too, since you put your head in the water, the water that's on your face, and the elements of your hair are starting to frost and freeze, and your head is already starting to get chillier than it was before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Out of the water's probably better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Beau, take the rod and put it on Fjord's head.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eyes are peeled this whole walk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm keeping an eye out for that chick that was at my shoulder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys continue going to the right or the left, or what would be the eastern or western sides of this lake?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one appears male, eyes missing, wispy hair slightly drifting and floating in the space, and it just glances in your direction for a moment before it turns around and then-- (whooshes) dissipates into the mist as well.

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: Like all the time? Because it seems like it's remote up here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You know, we get some folks from Uthodurn "who have, you know, want to be left "with the pride of the Allfather or the Wildmother, "and they bring their fallen or their dead "to be brought to dust, and then left to "find their destiny in the afterlife."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You haven't seen a Stone wander through here in recent years, have you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, no, no Stones, they keep themselves way south."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never had one, in my memory, anyway, where we come from, or at least if they did, they didn't make themselves known to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, to be honest, we haven't really had "any Clays come by in a long time, "or at all, (laughter) until recently."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much news of the outside world do you get up here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not too much, beyond what the dreams "from Melora come to us, and what the folks from Uthodurn "come forward and you know, share with us "when they bring their family, or they're just "looking to learn and craft," and she makes a motion up toward the forge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you cremate bodies in the same lava pools that you forge weapons, or do you like keep it separate for sanitation reasons?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's as clean as it gets.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was just curious if there was like a system.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You think they're putting people in the weapons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, depending where you place your interests, "maybe, but keep in mind, when the soul's gone, "a body's really just meat."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caduceus Clay, pleasure to meet you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, that is, from the Clays again, we have another."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How were the Clays coming through, Constance and Corrin especially, did they--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I talked with them a bit more than Mum did."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They seemed fine, a bit perturbed, "and you know, looking for answers, "and they were looking for some kind of glass stuff."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They said they had visions of some materials."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That means that whatever you talked about with them probably got written down?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do come on business as well, there are things that I was hoping to discuss, but this is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, any questions you've got, please ask, "I mean, we're happy to have company."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You said the Stones stay further south?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you know how much further south? We've come from there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No offense, you're not really looking forward to going "to the Savalirwood, so we just kept to our own."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair, again, it took us an awful long time to come here, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, but you did eventually, it was nice."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's in the Savalirwood? Is that where we found you, right? We came from there, and then we went away, and then we went back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I know, but how far is the Savalirwood from where we are right now? No, I know, but like, in--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, so we've been close to this before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were on the cusp of this region, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why would they come to you looking for glass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know, they said they had some sort of visions "from the Wildmother, trying to guide them."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you? Because you could, you know, you have the heat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, but, "it's not the kind that they were looking for, at least."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you remind us what the blade of the Star Razor was made out of?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do have a piece that may need reforging, and I would be curious to see your process here, I don't suppose that you have anyone that you're expecting to feed to the fire anytime soon, but I would love to learn as much as I can while I'm here, about what you do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've traveled quite a bit, I'm sure we're a little tired, if it would be possible to stay the night, at the very least.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of quarters do you guys have here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We don't really have much "in the way of guest quarters, "but Ichabod is still out with our sons, Brum, Brumhelm, "and they're off to Uthodurn."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But, you know, it's close by, comparatively, "it's got things that we obviously don't have "access to here, "and so we do often, you know, there's some folks "come to us to trade and sell, or we go over there "and do the same, and when things run low, "we have to make a journey ourselves, that kind of deal."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's maybe a day and a half travel, not too far."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That might be on the way out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was really hoping that Traveler Con would have like, a hotel nearby or something, but this is a little more difficult.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this where Traveler Con's happening?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought that was a different volcano.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I thought about this volcano.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The vision that you were given from the Wildmother, the one that began to give you flashes of this, elements of it keep sparking in your memory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There was one that involved taking these shards of green glass-like material and placing them within the fire, and they would be transformed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do not have green glass, if I recall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what about that bag that you took?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you have a bag of green stone?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a bag of green dust, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like it could have been crushed glassy sort of stuff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That bag of green dust that she took?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you show it to Clay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, Clay? Jester thinks that this green powder is green glass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does have a very, very similar color.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How angry would you be if I tried?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To do an alchemical work on it? Of course, I would be happy to assist.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it's taking natural things, but doing a lot more measuring and tinkering, with things that don't mix in nature normally.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think maybe it might even have something, I pull out the broken sword, show them what I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm going to need Khemdal for this, "I'm just a lorekeeper here, this is more, Khemdal!" Eventually you see coming through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Short blond hair, mutton chops curled into a finely groomed mustache.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's the-- oh, who are these people?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The world is-- The world is being unkind to the natural world right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And this big ugly guy named the Laughing Hand, he got loose, and Clay thinks that maybe that the the sword that we can reforge will help defeat him, because he's really hard to beat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is, oh, this looks like-- this looks like Dulgrim make."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's come back here many times making--"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys recall, Dulgrim Smeltborne was the name that came up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now he goes, "I haven't seen him for some time, "but he's from Uthodurn."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So this isn't something that can be fixed here, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What about this? And I'm going to show the residuum, the bag of residuum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He said he saw visions of glass.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could this be the glass that my family talked about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hold on a second," and she goes through and leaves for a moment and then comes back with a book and starts thumbing through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not much I know about that, unfortunately."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We probably need to go to Whitestone to get it, then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I recall, is this the kiln I saw in the vision? Like, this is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There could be multiples in the building, you don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What could it hurt, come on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm nothing if not a believer in a leap of faith.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Try to make glass out of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to act out what I saw in my dream.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Act out? What did you see in your dream?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was dropping the glass into the pool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should Nott try to turn it into glass?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you turn it into glass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What would you like to try?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would like to think back on anything that I might have seen or know about glass making or melting or pouring into form.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heat the crucible, sand granules being brought to a certain point where they melt together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, honestly, throwing this into the pit may do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, well we need something to put it in, right? Do they have some forms?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Khemdal goes like, "I got something here that could help you." Reaches up to one of the chains and pulls off a long hand-held crucible that's a thick steel bowl at the end of it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, the question, though, so your vision you had is to put glass into the magma here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So the same thing, it would be dispersed, it would be destroyed, the same thing will happen to the dust, so I'm not sure we need to make it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What he's looking for is refined.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Still, it's worth looking at it, and these visions are not always necessarily--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll see some impurities come to the surface.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sometimes it's just about feeling like you're doing the right thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want refined glass, is that right? All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This may work, this may not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beyond faith, though, does it hurt to take the extra steps?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just to do it? Because faith is great and all, but also, you know, taking a few extra steps, just for precaution.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And if you have the time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you propose other than just using the crucible there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, no, I'm saying do that as opposed to throwing the dust in the magma.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would want to try with maybe like a third or a quarter of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to do the whole thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The whole bag that you have is about that big.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, well let's just try how much will fit in the crucible for now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It accounts to-- if you want to mark this down, if you're taking a look at it-- you're not-- make an intelligence check, actually.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have 950 gold worth of residuum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which means 950 gold worth of material components from spells can be replaced with this residuum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's why residuum is a useful material.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, Whitestone's refined stuff actually itself can enhance and quicken the enchanting process, which is why it's so sought after, and it's a definitive secret of Whitestone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: On the broken blade of the Star Razor, the runes that are in the blade, are they engraved in like a relief, or are they etched in? Like is there a space where something could fill that rune, or is it more like a fine inlay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of it is an elvish based script, there's more of a scrolling and a light etching.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we go back in where we are now, the best thing that any of us can do is get better right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can try to make this glass, but what will it get us? What's the end? You're going to throw it in a pool?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to throw it in a pool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so you want to use all of it or just some of it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A third is a healthy amount.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't we look at it as an experiment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, about 300 gold worth, which is a nice apple-sized amount of this residuum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I try to ascertain if it's mostly pure, if it's corrupted with any other stuff? He said we need it refined, so I'm just going to see if I can, I don't know, sort it, sift it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Nott) It's a cup of angel dust.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Brought to you by the letter--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's just put it in the crucible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've been holding it there for now six minutes, seven minutes--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How soon should you take it out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would Nott know, though? Have you made glass before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glass can happen pretty quickly, especially at this temperature, so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I don't think it can hurt to just keep cooking it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll cool it off and see if there's any change.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is as granular as it was when you placed it in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is unaffected by the heat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and place your fingers onto the residuum dust?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over it? I mean, the metal is emanating a lot of heat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I recall any sort of chemicals that would help a process of this, of making glass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are many different chemicals you could try, if you want to make an intelligence check plus your alchemy proficiency bonus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just adding a benefit for your experience--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just add your proficiency bonus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Proficiency, we're at six now, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there's different chemicals that can have--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like a catalyst, some sort of catalyst?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are, you know, sulfurs or--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe things we have vials of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to walk over to the bag.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to put my hand in it, if that's all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just take a scoop of it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you going to snort it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to walk over to the fire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hold my hand--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Close as it can get to over the fire before it singes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your hairs on your arm begin to curl back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'm going to scatter it in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It all drifts, and you can see the dark spots where now it's-- with that handful, it's about 150 of that residuum that is taken off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch it know hit it and just rest there before eventually it just vanishes into the molten rock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that it's always an experiment?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that if you're not willing to move forward in it until you know, then you don't need it, do you? If you know--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In my memory, I thought of no particular catalyst that might make this lower melting points of different sort of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the sake of me not going here and spewing a bunch of incorrect chemical information for all of our chemists who are watching the show who would just destroy me on Twitter, there are a handful that you think of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Might I have anything in my possession that I could try?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, I'll say go ahead and make another alchemist proficiency, if you want to try and pull out and refine some of this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's conducting the heat, it's just not changing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing seems to be adjusting its format.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to start casting Commune as I sit by the kiln.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Quick, teleport me back to Nicodranas.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could send a message to him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What should I say to Yeza? Like, okay, what--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What catalyst should use? Maybe you can say "should we use."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Residuum, how do we turn residuum into glass?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He might not know what residuum is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's actually pretty narrow knowledge, largely in arcane fields, and magic practitioners that know of it, and even then, it's a pretty rare material.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have just taken some incense and just scattered it in front of it, right at the base of the kiln so that I can breathe it in from the kiln as I sit and wait for the trance to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The heat rolls away, and much like the early morning light of a dawning sun, you feel the warmth surround you, and the wrapping and safe presence of the mother that's guided you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm supposed to be searching for the refined residuum for this kiln.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather the answer is clarifying it to be a definitive yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is Whitestone the most accessible-- is that the closest place to find such material?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you get the sense the answer is no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Will I find the man who can reforge this sword in the city that he is from? Ulda-- I can't pronounce it, because--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The man who can reforge this sword in the city where he's from.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I find him in that city? Uthodurn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As her grip pulls away from you, the love that's encircled you doesn't entirely leave, but withdraws, and once more the scent of smoke and soot fills your senses, and your eyes open, slightly watering, sitting amongst the Underforge, your friends staring at you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need to find the refined residuum.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, what if we can make it here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think it can be made, I think it can only be found.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you think we could go to Laura Dern and find it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that that's going to be part of what we do next, but I do know that if you're willing tomorrow, we can go get your sword reforged.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that all you need to do here before we leave?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I need to talk, and I would appreciate spending the night, but I get the distinct impression that I'm going to be back very quickly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, I have a question, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dulgrim, the guy that forged the sword, right? Khemdal? You said that Dulgrim comes here to work sometimes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is this anvil like, stronger or better than something that he would have at Uthodurn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "These all tell tales of all the fine crafts "that have been made here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we see anything about the sword?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, anyone, who reads--? (gasps) I read Dwarvish! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah! Languages are a big part of the Cobalt Soul, and I picked none that were useful thus far, sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those are some pretty good selections, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're that kid who took Latin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought Deep Speech was going to be relevant--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you find it, can you find the sword?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look for the Star Razor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just read the whole fucking thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Underforge is also spoken of as a lesser sister creation of another object referred to as the Core Anvil that was lost deep beneath the Ozmit Sea long ago.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it doesn't, never heard of it before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Almost like a dream from another time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) It's where we made the shards for killing Vecna.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm having a very hard time separating my desires from my character's right now, which is very-- just a lot of candy on the table.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, is that it, nothing of the Star Razor or Dwueth'var?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to spend a while tonight, it's a lot of reading to do, but you do eventually come onto the Star Razor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to roll a history check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do want to roll a history check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, I mean like, it is cocked, but it-- oh, it's leaning, that's why.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was strange to see it cocked in that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, through some strange, not entirely understood cataclysm, the city fell and the surrounding forest was corrupted, which is now known as the Savalirwood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Joined Uthodurn, which had previously been founded by the dwarves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Half went to Uthodurn, half went to the Savalirwood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or fled there and went to the Empire.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Savalirwood is where it was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking here, you can see in the center of the Savalirwood map you have, the ruins of Molaesmyr are marked there as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I send a message to Dulgrim and see if he's around?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How can you do that? Do you need to know what he looks like?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think if I just know his name, could be wrong.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or we can just have a good old-fashioned quest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Am I familiar with him, I know his name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know the name, that is a level of familiarity, you can certainly try.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could ask the Dusts what he looks like, what his personality's like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, right, yeah, he's a squat lad, "broad shoulders, got black hair, "thinning in the front but strong and heavy, thick mat "in the back, bulbous nose, looks like it's taken "a few hits in his youth, piercing bright light blue eyes, "almost like a gray-white in color."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dwarf, dwarf." Goes into this full description of the different stages in which they had met in the times that he had visited to do the forging here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How old would must he be now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I think nearing fourth century, if not partially--"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's like super old for a dwarf.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's going to be hard for him to get here, then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a day and a half journey.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, may I ask, is it possible that you have a teleportation circle here on the premises?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you can still send him a message.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you can tell by his voice when he picks up how feeble he is, you know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, we're going to head to the city anyway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was going to say, if he's able, then he could just come here, but you know, if he's like--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Plus a heads up is good, it'll save us some time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not just trying to speed things along.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I actually agree with Caduceus, I don't think you want to pop into a stranger's head and say "Hey, here we are, here we come."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, is it rude or something?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think that people don't like it when I send them messages?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think people like it when they can already picture your beautiful face.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But a stranger popping into your consciousness is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would it be all right if we stayed the night?

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: I think we're going to have one soon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And again, if this thing-- I've never met a creature with one tentacle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go wander over and try to-- try to sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Something about it just kind of-- just draws your attention.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It means you're close to the exit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll see where the exit leads.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get some sleep, we've got a journey to find you a sword tomorrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was the thing on the anvil, was that etched into the anvil, the crook thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's cool, that's cool, that's cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Something Percy never pulled off, motherfucker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You just out-Percyed Percy, well done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does this unmake you a warlock?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since rest probably, you guys probably bedded down closer to midnight, so it's like 8:00, 9:00 in the morning.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I honestly don't know what we eat around here, but I'm happy to help cook, if that helps.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I got some pretty good rest, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, what are we doing today?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're making our way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd like to make sure that the records show that we were here, and where they can find us, to find the tree, to go find the house, if any other members of the Clay family wander their way up there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't worry, I'll go ahead and make sure in our books here "this is taken care of."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're going to be returning rather soon, anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well great, look forward to seeing you come back, then."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you guys have any breakfast stuff here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, right, if you're hungry, I can put a few on."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, do you have any like, pastries or anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you like a bead of nourishment?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh. How big is the bead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's the size of a boba.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I don't have enough, damn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's enough for a day, though, so if you eat the whole thing--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I don't have enough supplies to bake right now, do I?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I'm going to have to get some baking supplies.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's true. You could make like those little--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It technically would be a Clay oven.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It would be a Clay oven!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, do you want some of my bead?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll have a bit of that too, if you don't mind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I take one of those skewers to go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have something caught in your throat, Fjord? Something's-- like a little bubble.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you trying to convince somebody of something again?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean? Sometimes, all the time, really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Most of my life, yes, like this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was that other thing you were doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean he was Vandran?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My captain, Vandran, was a man of great renown and respect, and I wanted to emulate him, I wanted to

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well I liked it, I thought it was fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you can't summon it or something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, and I'll try and summon it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I, um-- I threw the sword into the liquid steel last night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was Vandran's sword, wasn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought you loved that sword.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Were you just over it, or--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you still feel like you have the balls inside you? Or are those gone, too?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I will try to make myself look like Caleb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are you trying to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nonsense, he's not powerless, he's just discovered a new power.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was having dreams of Uk'otoa commanding me to return, and to-- (sighs) And to do things, and I can't do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you said it came back before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was also without throwing the sword into a pool of lava, but yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's going to be really pissed at you, Fjord.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you feel pure, free, cleansed?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know what you're going to say, I know that you would disagree, but I enjoyed the abilities that I had.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: May I ask a question? Why the choice to drop the accent?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it tied to the sword?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or did you just feel the events coincided?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All your powers came from that sword?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are any of the Dusts awake?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you mind if I just?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Jeramess turns and goes, "If you don't mind not, you know, causing a huge racket "or setting us all on fire, maybe."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have like a wall that's less important that could take a little bit of, like a little--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, let's go punch a mountain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll walk out the tunnel just a little bit and see if I can just shoot out the tunnel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rays extend and blast into the side of the mountain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have things that are more useful than this, but for now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, you can also have my axe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a shield as well, if you like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I give him the whip and the axe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus, did you have the Mollymauk sword?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do have a shield though, if--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is more than enough, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's really not, you're very weak.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter) No, I appreciate it, I really do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you're on drugs, you'll think you're magic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have also talked us out of a good number of scrapes, and that has nothing to do with any sword or ball or what have you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sword, glove, what's the difference at the moment?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think there's anything wrong with utilizing tools to help get you where you are, and you know, maybe you're just at a place now where you don't need those things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But you have saved my skin, and I will be here if I can to save yours, second mate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go to a city where elves and dwarves mingle, shall we?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Before we go, can I just, out of morbid curiosity, could you--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you make a comment about my strength, I might throw you in the lava.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just because I'm curious, how would you say the words that are spelled E-L-D-R-I-G-E B-L-A-S-T? How would you pronounce that? How would you say those words?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter) I miss the old way you said it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You drew it out a little longer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You do know I can't do it though, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you could say it the way I like it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you are very good with accents.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What else you got? Maybe later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Since you were using your fake accent as your real accent, and then your real accent as your fake accent, when you talk to people does that mean you're going to like, switch it up now, and we're going to hear old school Fjord, or I guess technically like, middle Fjord before we knew Fjord, and then we got Fjord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still a gray sky ahead with little breaks of blue visible, but it seems like travel for this next day is going to be a little more comfortable than what met you as you arrived at Kravaraad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I had no idea where you were going to take that, and I was like, "Oh shit!" (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was about to take it back, and then--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now you just have to go find magic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just got to get him some powers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need that fucking sword, maybe the new sword will give him new powers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it'll be like Wildmother connected--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You got powers from the last sword, maybe this sword? Well, I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you going to turn into a cleric?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it like Spin the Bottle, put the sword on the ground and spin it and see what class it lands on?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then you got to make out with whatever sword lands on, wait.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So many questions! Maybe you'll become a paladin!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe this is just a weird dating sim.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see you guys then. In the meantime, have a wonderful week, we love you very much, and is it Thursday, Friday yet?
